intro: Erigeron pyrami, commonly known as the pyramid daisy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period typically occurs from late spring to early summer.
